job description:
What You Will Do: As a member of the Asset Liability Management (ALM) & Hedging team, you will work with senior staff to solve business problems using quantitative analytics, software engineering, statistics, economic analysis, finance, and accounting disciplines.

What You Will Learn: You will work on derivative asset modeling to support the trading desk and hedging team. You will get to work closely with the traders and be heavily involved in trading development and decisions.

What Success Looks Like:
  • Work closely with trading desk and hedge strategy team; Provide quantitative tools, analysis and general day-to-day quantitative support in terms of model building, implementation, and application building as well as pricing and risk management advice to traders.
  • Develop, deliver and maintain quantitative models to analyze risks in derivatives portfolio and provide system support for derivatives trading activity.
  • Model and quantify risks on different market factor sensitivities and P&L attributions of derivatives portfolio.
  • Produce, maintain or extend existing model implementations built in C++/Python.
  • Implement risk reports and processes automation for risk management and operation.
  • Create application and user interface with Python / Excel VBA for front desk.
What You Need:
  • Masters in mathematics, actuarial science, finance, economics, physics, computer science or engineering with at least 7 years relevant work experience
  • OR Bachelor's degree and FSA/CFA/Equivalent Designation plus 7 years relevant work experience
  • OR Bachelor's degree plus 10 years relevant work experience.
  • Communication skills to convey complex information to business both verbally and in writing at an appropriate level of detail for each audience.
  • Expertise on object oriented programming in C++, Ruby and Python on Linux.
  • Expertise on developing on Linux.
  • Experience with open source.
  • Working knowledge of SQL.
Preferably, the successful candidate will also possess the following:

Quantitative skills
  • Strong skills in mathematical / statistical analysis and modeling
  • Strong knowledge of capital market instruments and hedging strategies
  • Comprehensive understanding of financial mathematics, portfolio theory, and asset allocation techniques
  • Knowledge and professional experience with complex quantitative modeling, stochastics processes, PDE, numerical analysis, and probability theory
  • Proficient with models and algorithms for derivatives on all asset classes
Programming skills
  • Proficient programming skills in a major programming language (e.g. C++ C#, Python)
  • Strong knowledge of enterprise software and architecture
  • Solid software development background or understanding of software development principles
  • Experience involving software development and financial modeling in a trading environment
